definition[0]: someone who is in a worse situation than they were, because of something that has happened
example[0]: If the strike continues, the people of Galway will be the real losers.
definition[1]: someone who is never successful in life, work, or relationships
definition[2]: someone who has lost a competition, game, election etc
note[0]: good/bad loser (=someone who behaves well or badly after losing)
definition[3]: a share that decreases in value on a particular day of trading on a stockmarket
example[3]: Automakers were among the biggest losers this week, hurt by news about reduced production schedules.
